reflect

Class ReflectionUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • reflect.ReflectionUtilities

  • public final class ReflectionUtilities
extends Object
    The ReflectionUtilities class contains utility methods that perform reflective operations.

    Notable operations include:

    • invoke(Object, Method, Object...), which wraps the invocation of a given Method. Exists because RuntimeException is ugly.
    • newInstance(Class), which facilitates for creating instances from a generic type.
    • mapFields(Class, Function, Function), which wraps the creation of Map objects from the fields declared in the given Class.
    Author:
    Oliver Abdulrahim

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        public static Object invoke(Object obj,
                            Method m,
                            Object... args)
        Invokes the given method from the given object using the given (optional) arguments, returning
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to invoke the method on. This value may be null if the supplied method is static.
        m - The method to invoke using the given data.
        args - The arguments to invoke the given method with. This value is not required to be supplied.
        Returns:
        The return value of the method, or null if the method is void.

      • set

        public static void set(Object obj,
                       Field f,
                       Object value)
        Sets the value of the given field to the given value within the given object.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object the given Field is declared in. This value may be null if the Field is static.
        f - The Field whose value to set to the given Object.
        value - The value to assign to the given Field.

      • newInstance

        public static <T> T newInstance(Class<? extends T> c)
        Creates and returns an instance of the given Class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the instance to create.
        Parameters:
        c - The class of the instance to create.
        Returns:
        An instance of the given class.

      • getValue

        public static Object getValue(Object obj,
                              Field f)
        Returns the value stored within the given Field. Primitive values are wrapped in their respective object before they are returned.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object from which to extract the value of the given Field in. This value may be null if the given Field is declared static.
        f - The field whose value to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The value stored within the given Field.

      • mapFields

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> mapFields(Class<?> c,
                                       Function<? super Field,K> keyMapper,
                                       Function<? super Field,V> valueMapper)
        Maps all fields contained within the given Class using the given key and value mapping functions.
        Type Parameters:
        K - The output type of the key mapping function, and type of the keys of the returned Map.
        V - The output type of the value mapping function, and the type of the values of the returned Map.
        Parameters:
        c - The class whose values to map.
        keyMapper - A mapping function to produce keys for the new Map.
        valueMapper - A mapping function to produce values for the new Map.
        Returns:
        A Map whose keys and values are the result of the given functions and the fields of the given Class.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A Stream of the fields declared in the given Class.

        Parameters:
        c - The class whose fields to Stream.
        finisher - The filter to apply after constructing the Stream.
        Returns:
        A Stream of the fields declared in the given Class.

      • getterFor

        public static Method getterFor(Class<?> c,
                               Field f)
        Returns the Method determined to be the getter for the given Field.
        Parameters:
        c - The Class whose methods to introspect.
        f - The Field whose getter to find.
        Returns:
        The Method determined to be the getter for the given Field.
        Throws:
        NoSuchMethodError - if there is no Method determined to be the getter for the given Field.
